part.narration: Friday evening, after work. Yuki makes plans.
part.line: Well, guys—
part.narration: A split second after the Player chooses a hobby event, Nozomi cancels her decision.Nozomi jumps up.
part.line: Great week, everyone! Let's go to the bar!
part.narration: Yuki shivers and twitches.
part.line: Yes sure she is has good idea we will drinking is good for your health and your mind!
part.narration: .Sudden cut from the studio to the bar.The entrance of the bar. The whole team shuffles past Yuki, into the bar. Yuki looks at the entrance. Something is suspicious about this door. Yuki marches on. She stops just before the door. A dialogue box pops up.
part.line: Would you like to enter the bar?

choice.narration: Yuki hears a harsh beeping sound. Invalid action.
choice.line: Would you like to enter the bar?
choice.narration: Yuki cannot enter.Continue to ask the player until they say No.

choice.line: Good looks, Madeline. Run along, now.

part.narration: A college-age girl with black-dyed hair emerges from the other side of the fortress. She's dressed to a drunk old pervert's strangest fantasies.
part.line: My deepest apologies, Mademoiselle. This hostess club is Japanese Only.
Japanese Only?
Japanese Only.
part.narration: The sun begins to set. The Tokyo summer heat subsides. Yuki takes a long hard look at this girl.
part.line: You're not Japanese.
part.narration: The hostess folds her arms.Dialogue boxes for response appear the instant the hostess begins to talk.
part.line: Look, blondie. I got tuition to pay and you're wasting my time—

choice.line: How dare you shield yourself behind the nature of your work.
How dare you toss around "Mademoiselle" when you know exactly what it implies—
It implies that for politeness' sake,
I choose to ignore the crow's feet under your makeup!
I don't know where you came from where you didn't have to get by,
But we're in a recession! People need money! No exceptions!

part.narration: Silence. Yuki glares at this girl.
part.line: What's your name?
Ayane.
Ayane what?
Ayane, dammit.
Now beat it, blondie, before I get the muscles.

choice.narration: Yuki stands until Ayane gets the muscles.
A voice rumbles from the door.
choice.line: I love seeing what white girls do in the face of prejudice!
choice.narration: Suji bursts out of the front door and charges at Yuki.
Yuki runs, screaming. Yards away, she catches her breath.
Yuki stands tall still. Suji stops straight in front of her. He shields his face.

He takes hold of Yuki by the shoulders, turns her around, and escorts her off the premises. The Player can still move Yuki in the opposite direction, but the man is well synchronized to Yuki's axis. He keeps pushing. Escort is inevitable.Far from the bar, Yuki stumbles, then bursts into laughter.

part.comment: After walking away, the camera is positioned so that the player is unable to see the bar.
part.line: I better get home.
part.narration: Yuki begins to walk home. Before Yuki's Ears is heavenly music in the distance. When she reaches her house, the music fades away.Any action the player does that involves going through a door will lead to a sudden cut to the train. For example...Yuki turns the knob of her front door.Sudden cut so that Yuki, in the same position, is moving through the turnstile of the train station. Small delay.

Yuki is on a train. Next to Yuki, holding hands are two Salarymen. One French, one Japanese. The Japanese man stares into the Frenchman's eyes and nudges him with his nose. Passing to a seat on the train is a hot chick. The French breaks away to get a good look. The Japanese slap him. Yuki pays them no mind.
part.line: It's Saturday night and I'm not a complete loser anymore, right?
part.narration: On Yuki's other side, playing the plumber-who-races-dinosaurs game are two children, one French, one Japanese. The French child stares at her screen in disbelief. She's in last place. The French turns off the game-system. The Japanese pout. Yuki pays them no mind.
part.line: I shouldn't be at home when people with friends are out and about.
part.narration: Yuki stands up and holds the bar. This is her stop.Sudden cut to front door of the arcade.Club Sega, Akihabara. The outside of the club looks a bit run down. Maintenance is expensive. We're in a recession. The inside of the club is completely different. Swing music blares. All are in dress and suit. A man at the front looks at Yuki. He dashes into the building and returns with a different man to greet her.
part.line: Evening, Mademoiselle, and welcome to Club Sega.
part.narration: The man begins to follow Yuki throughout the arcade, watching her closely.The Player can continue walking into the arcade; the greeter follows Yuki, burdening her, becoming part of the party.
part.line: Please do not hack our computerized credit system or our power grid.
You are a hacker, right?
part.narration: Yuki gets ready to answer—Dialogue box pops up for a split second and disappears, all options blank.
part.line: I, uh—
Please do not physically harm opponent players in the event that you are about to lose.
If you cannot read the health warnings on the arcade games, please do not play them—
Currently, the second, third, and fourth floors are unavailable.
All arcade machines have been reinforced with titanium for your banging pleasure.
part.narration: Yuki pushes him away.
part.line: Yeah, alright.
part.narration: The man walks away, still watching Yuki.He is not dismissed from the party.

This amusement parlor is different. There are no UFO catchers here. There are no horse-machines here. There are no photo booths or pachinko boxes. Only worlds and their masters. Only culture and its curators. The patrons of the parlor put passion into their play. Cigar smoke fills the air. Scotch glasses lie on control panels. People bang machines. People yell. People cheer. People are real. This is beyond an arcade; this is a club.
part.line: I knew people around here actually cared about games, but this is nuts.
I better get my credits and see what the fuss is all about.
part.narration: Yuki goes to the credits machine. She takes out her money.
part.line: This is only enough Yen for one game.
I just rode all the way here, and all I get is one game?
part.narration: Yuki clenches her card and laughs.Camera dolly out on Yuki. Show the player the variety of arcade games available for play. Allow player to choose one.
part.line: And so, economics forces upon a westerner the One-Credit Clear.
Play on.
part.narration: Yuki plays a game. Two men pass by, one looks as if he is an ally. "Suzuki," says his nametag.
part.line: ...arcade gaming is the supernova of this recession.
The hardcore may adore the new, game-heavy, high-quality setup,
but we only maintain it because the hardcore are the only ones who still come.
So arcades will become heavens — For a few months.
And if this industry doesn't change its models, even Japanese arcades will die.
I don't think I'll come back if the arcade dies—
Takeshi?
part.narration: Yuki continues to play the game as she talks.
part.line: Huh?
So you're the new Vice Prez!
Yeah!
Yu Suzuki. I'm manning Sega's last arcade, so I can't really be at the office.
Anyway, congratulations— at the current Sega, Vice Presidents are kings.
I really should find a better way to help from here.
Hey, how about I get you guys computer parts? Somebody's gotta do it.
That's fantastic! We're expanding. You can be in charge of providing us with workstations.
Yeah, just think— Yu Suzuki, Sega's sole connection to cutting-edge technology...
